text: Read this #preprint on @researchsquare: Effectiveness of the BNT162b2 mRNA COVID-19 Vaccine in Pregnancy https://t.co/BfxN8sS7Fv led by @RanBalicer Noa Dagan Noam Barda Ben Reis

@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol @mgmgomes1 "Prof. Ran Balicer (@RanBalicer), the chief of the professional coronavirus cabinet which advises the Israel's coronavirus cabinet, added that it is very difficult to gauge vaccine efficacy when COVID tests are performed selectively."
@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol @mgmgomes1 Others are also concerned that the estimates may be confounded https://t.co/n7EMF2VNVw
@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol @mgmgomes1 These are always concerns which is why studies like SIREN which compare across variants in the same population are especially compelling.

@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol @mgmgomes1 So one could construct a scenario under which the VE is lower in the absence of masks (higher exposure dose, maybe) but would expect also higher in the lower-transmission setting.  Or confounding could be an issue with nonvaccinees also being less cautious about exposure.
@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol @mgmgomes1 More recently David Kaslow has found a similar pattern for force of infection and malaria vaccines https://t.co/OA5OcFdR3x

@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol @mgmgomes1 and have found the small amount of empirical evidence available is consistent with a reduced efficacy against higher doses (saturation) https://t.co/VLpNrUPptp

@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol as if it were a constant of nature like Planck's constant, at least for a given vaccine against a given strain.  We know that is an approximation.  We (@mgmgomes1 especially) have raised the question of whether this is true across exposure doses https://t.co/NmjkbCT3EX

@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol It is generally assumed that vaccination reduces risk or hazard of infection by the same amount regardless of other factors, ie that vaccine efficacy against a given pathogen in one setting will be similar in others. I've never seen that articulated, but we talk about VE...

@meher_k_prakash @CrushCovid @EricTopol simple answer is that should not affect it, because VE was measured comparing vaccinated (w masks if following the rules) to unvacc (w masks if following the rules). Randomization and blinding, or adequate control in observational studies, should balance masks/dist btw vax, unvax
